blocks.text: The total curvature of an arc of a curve is the angle through which the tangent turns as its point of contact moves from one end of the arc to the other; and the mean curvature is given by the total curvature divided by the length of arc.

blocks.latex:
\text{In Fig. 108, } \kappa_s \text{ is total curvature for the arc } s, \text{ and the mean curvature is} \kappa = \frac{B}{s}.

Now, for a beam, \text{if } s \text{ is very small, } \kappa

\text{This result may be arrived at more briefly, but approximately, in the following manner:}
\kappa_s \approx \frac{dy}{ds} = \frac{d}{ds} \text{ ratio of change of the tangent (for PM and PQ are sensibly alike).}
